The claim was fact: checked using data from the federal Bureau of Labor Statistics, specifically focusing on the annual averages for median, inflation-adjusted, usual, weekly earnings for full-time wage and salary workers.
Two economists: Tara Sinclair of George Washington University and Gary Burtless of the Brookings Institution, were consulted and confirmed that the chosen metric was appropriate for verifying the claim.
However: it was clarified that the phrasing used by O'Malley, stating "12 years in a row of wages declining," was misleading. The data showed that wages fluctuated over the 12-year period, with both increases and decreases, resulting in a sideways trend rather than a steady decline.
